CatDescriptText: Pearl Herring, high school senior, 2201 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that theatrical productions like 'The Green Pastures,' which 'take-off' on religions, should be presented as entertainment?" answer reads: "I do not think so. The Bible should not be made into an amusing thing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pearl Herring wearing light colored coat, holding collar closed, standing in front of grocery store, with signs in window, including one reading "Eggs 3 dz. $ .39"
